topic.title: FPI Reshaping

body.p: The Device provides the capability to generate a periodic 8kHz signal that is synchronized to rising edges of an input reference pulse provided on the device FPI input. An optional maskable window can be placed around the generated pulse in order to ignore small movements in the input synchronization pulse.

The Device implements a flywheel counter for the FPI device input. This counter will generate an internal 8 kHz signal provided that the incoming FPI signal occurs with a period that is an integer multiple of 125 µs. For example, a 2 kHz frame pulse that occurs every 500 µs is supported. The resulting internal 8 kHz FPI signal is used to synchronize SAR packet header timestamps carried by data transmitted across the backplane fabric or across the ODUk switch.

The size of the windowing mechanism for the device FPI input is configurable from a minimum of -48.23ns / +38.58 ns to a maximum of -626.93 ns / +617.28 ns. Accuracy of the window is ±3.215 ns due to sampling error of the device FPI input.
